bmp280_driver.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import rospy
4 from smbus2 import SMBusWrapper
5 
6 #recommended sampling frequency = 3
7 #x16 oversampling
8 
9 ## BMP280 default address (0x77).
10 BMP280_I2CADDR = 0x77
11 
12 # BMP280 Temperature Registers
13 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_T1 = 0x88
14 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_T2 = 0x8A
15 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_T3 = 0x8C
16 
17 # BMP280 Pressure Registers
18 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P1 = 0x8E
19 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P2 = 0x90
20 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P3 = 0x92
21 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P4 = 0x94
22 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P5 = 0x96
23 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P6 = 0x98
24 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P7 = 0x9A
25 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P8 = 0x9C
26 BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P9 = 0x9E
27 
28 BMP280_REGISTER_CONTROL = 0xF4
29 BMP280_REGISTER_CONFIG = 0xF5
30 #Pressure measurments
31 BMP280_REGISTER_PRESSUREDATA_MSB = 0xF7
32 BMP280_REGISTER_PRESSUREDATA_LSB = 0xF8
33 BMP280_REGISTER_PRESSUREDATA_XLSB = 0xF9
34 #Temperature measurments
35 BMP280_REGISTER_TEMPDATA_MSB = 0xFA
36 BMP280_REGISTER_TEMPDATA_LSB = 0xFB
37 BMP280_REGISTER_TEMPDATA_XLSB = 0xFC
38 
39 # Commands
40 BMP280_READCMD = 0x3F
41 
42 #Always read tempurature first then pressure in main program!!!
43 
44 class BMP280:
45 
46  ##The constructor
47  # @param addr Sets the I2C device address
48  def __init__(self, addr=0x77):
49  self.address = addr
50 
51  #calibration values
52  calibrationSuccess = False
53  attempts = 0
54  self.tfine = 0
55  while(calibrationSuccess == False and attempts < 10):
56  try:
57  self.loadCalibration()
58  with SMBusWrapper(1) as bus:
59  try:
60  #put sensor into normal mode - ultra high resolution
61  bus.write_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_CONTROL, 0xFF)
62  bus.write_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_CONFIG, 0x1C)
63  except Exception as e:
64  rospy.logerr("Error writting mode and settings to BMP280 sensor: %s", e)
65  calibrationSuccess = True
66  except Exception as e:
67  attempts += 1
68  rospy.logerr("Error reading BMP280 calibration data: %s", e)
69  rospy.sleep(0.25)
70 
71  if(attempts == 10):
72  rospy.logerr("BMP280 failed program closing!")
73  exit()
74  ##Updates the raw bmp280 sensor values and stores them into class member variables to be extracted by the getter functions.
75  # Must be run before getting sensor values.
76  def updateValues(self):
77 
78  with SMBusWrapper(1) as bus:
79  #read 16 bit temp and humidity with 2 CRC bytes (6 bytes)
80  numOfTries = 0
81  while(numOfTries < 4):
82  try:
83  #Read raw tempurature data
84  msb = bus.read_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_TEMPDATA_MSB)
85  lsb = bus.read_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_TEMPDATA_LSB)
86  xlsb = bus.read_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_TEMPDATA_XLSB)
87  self.rawTemp = ((msb << 8 | lsb) << 8 | xlsb) >> 4
88  #Read raw pressure data
89  msb = bus.read_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_PRESSUREDATA_MSB)
90  lsb = bus.read_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_PRESSUREDATA_LSB)
91  xlsb = bus.read_byte_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_PRESSUREDATA_XLSB)
92  self.rawPressure = ((msb << 8 | lsb) << 8 | xlsb) >> 4
93 
94  self.readError = False
95  break
96  except Exception as e:
97  rospy.logerr("BMP280 read error: %s", e)
98  self.readError = True
99  numOfTries+=1
100  rospy.sleep(.001)
101  #print "Retrying..."
102  if(self.readError):
103  self.rawTemp = 0
104  self.rawPressure = 0
105 
106  ##Gets the absolute tempurature in celcius
107  # @return Tempurature in celcius
108  def getTempuratureC(self):
109  TMP_PART1 = (((self.rawTemp>>3) - (self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T1<<1)) * self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T2) >> 11
110  TMP_PART2 = (((((self.rawTemp>>4) - (self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T1)) * ((self.rawTemp>>4) - (self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T1))) >> 12) * (self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T3)) >> 14
111  TMP_FINE = TMP_PART1 + TMP_PART2
112  ## Value needed for tempurature compensation on pressure and altitude values
113  self.tfine = TMP_FINE
114  self.temp = ((TMP_FINE*5+128)>>8)/100.0
115  return self.temp
116 
117  ##Gets the absolute compensated pressure in pascal
118  # @return Pressure in pascal
119  def getPressureP(self):
120  #for pressure calculation we need a temperature, checking if we have one, and reading data if not
121  self.getTempuratureC()
122 
123  var1 = self.tfine - 128000
124  var2 = var1 * var1 * self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P6
125  var2 = var2 + ((var1*self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P5)<<17);
126  var2 = var2 + ((self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P4)<<35);
127  var1 = ((var1 * var1 * self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P3)>>8) + ((var1 * self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P2)<<12);
128  var1 = ((((1)<<47)+var1))*(self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P1)>>33;
129 
130  if var1 == 0:
131  return 0
132 
133  p = 1048576 - self.rawPressure;
134  p = int((((p<<31) - var2)*3125) / var1);
135  var1 = ((self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P9) * (p>>13) * (p>>13)) >> 25;
136  var2 = ((self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P8) * p) >> 19;
137 
138  p = ((p + var1 + var2) >> 8) + ((self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P7)<<4);
139  self.pressure = p / 256.0
140 
141  #return pressure in pascals
142  return self.pressure;
143 
144  ##Gets the absolute compensated pressure in atm
145  # @return Pressure in atm
146  def getPressureA(self):
147  return self.getPressureP()/101325
148 
149 
150  ##Gets the relative compensated pressure in pascal with relation to a known altitude
151  # @param altitude_m Known altitude in meters for a relative pressure setting
152  # @return Relative pressure in pascal
153  def getPressureSeaLevelP(self, altitude_m=0.0):
154  #Calculates the pressure at sealevel when given a known altitude in meters. Returns a value in Pascals.
155  self.getPressureP()
156  pressure = float(self.pressure)
157  p0 = pressure / pow(1.0 - altitude_m/44330.0, 5.255)
158  return p0
159 
160  ##Gets the relative altitude in meters with relation to pressure at sealevel
161  # @param sealevel_pa Known pressure in pascal for a relative altitude setting
162  # @return Relative altitude in meters
163  def getAltitudeM(self, sealevel_pa=101325.0):
164  self.getPressureP()
165  altitude = 44330.0 * (1.0 - pow(self.pressure / sealevel_pa, (1.0/5.255)))
166  #return altitude in meters
167  return altitude
168 
169  ##Loads factory calibration data set on the BMP280
170  def loadCalibration(self):
171  with SMBusWrapper(1) as bus:
172  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T1 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_T1) # UINT16
173  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T2 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_T2) # INT16
174  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_T3 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_T3) # INT16
175  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P1 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P1) # UINT16
176  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P2 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P2) # INT16
177  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P3 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P3) # INT16
178  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P4 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P4) # INT16
179  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P5 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P5) # INT16
180  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P6 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P6) # INT16
181  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P7 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P7) # INT16
182  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P8 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P8) # INT16
183  self.cal_REGISTER_DIG_P9 = bus.read_word_data(self.address, BMP280_REGISTER_DIG_P9) # INT16
